page.title: 12HORTICULTURE AND GARDENING
page.content: In the Axbridge and Cheddar Valley area{market gardening}is an important occupation. On the slopes of the Mendips and lower ground you will find{'growers'}and nursery men. The land is ideal for this purpose. The 'moorland' found on te levels is{peat}based. This is not moss peat but sedge peat. The peat can be burnt but most is used by the horticultural industry. It can be used to improve the soil structure or (after being enriched with nutrients) can be sealed in plastic bags. These are given the name{'grow bags'.}Slits are cut in the bags and plants such as tomatoes are planted in the peat. In addition to the professional growers you will often see small roadside stalls selling surplus home grown produce.
